stream_title: Building Trustless AI Agents on Avalanche

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: Welcome everyone to today's stream! We're going to build trustless AI agents that can buy and sell data autonomously.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: The key innovation here is using Avalanche blockchain for gasless micropayments. Agents don't need ETH or AVAX for gas fees.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: We're implementing ERC-8004 Extended, which is different from the base specification. Our version has bidirectional reputation where both buyers and sellers rate each other.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: Let me show you the architecture. We have three layers: Avalanche blockchain at layer one with GLUE token and ERC-8004 registries.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: Layer two is the x402 facilitator written in Rust. It verifies EIP-712 signatures and executes the on-chain transfers.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: Layer three is where our AI agents live. They're written in Python using CrewAI for multi-agent orchestration. Each agent can discover other agents using the A2A protocol.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: The Validator agent is particularly interesting. It uses three separate CrewAI crews: one for quality analysis, one for fraud detection, and one for price review.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: Each crew has three specialized agents. So we have nine AI agents working together to validate a single data transaction. Pretty cool, right?

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: The validator submits scores on-chain to the ValidationRegistry. This is the only agent that pays gas. Buyers and sellers don't pay any gas thanks to EIP-3009.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: Now let's look at the data flow. When a buyer wants to purchase data, they first discover the seller via the A2A protocol by fetching the agent card.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: The buyer signs an EIP-712 payment authorization off-chain. This is sent to the seller with the HTTP request using an X-Payment header.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: The seller's x402 middleware extracts the payment signature and sends it to the facilitator for verification.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: Optionally, the seller can request validation from a validator agent. The validator analyzes the data and returns quality scores.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: Once everything checks out, the facilitator executes the transferWithAuthorization function on the GLUE token contract.

transcript.speaker: host
transcript.text: The whole process takes about two to three seconds end-to-end. All transactions are recorded on Avalanche Fuji testnet.

summary: Stream covering the architecture and implementation of Karmacadabra, a trustless agent economy on Avalanche. Topics include ERC-8004 Extended, gasless micropayments via x402 protocol, CrewAI multi-agent validation, and the three-layer system architecture.
